member.summary: If an EntitiesDescriptor element is found when loading metadata for an IdentityProvider, automatically check inside it if there is a single EntityDescriptor and in that case use it.

member.name: P:Sustainsys.Saml2.Configuration.Compatibility.DisableLogoutStateCookie
member.summary: Do not send logout state cookie, e.g. if you are not using ReturnUrl or if you know the cookie will be lost due to cross-domain redirects

member.name: P:Sustainsys.Saml2.Configuration.Compatibility.StrictOwinAuthenticationMode
member.summary: Honor the owin authentication mode even on logout. Normally the logout handling is always done as if the middleware was active, to allow for simple sign out without specifying an auth type.

member.name: P:Sustainsys.Saml2.Configuration.Compatibility.IgnoreAuthenticationContextInResponse
member.summary: Do not read the AuthnContext element in Saml2Response. If you do not need these values to be present as claims in the generated identity, using this option can prevent XML format errors (IDX13102) e.g. when value cannot parse as absolute URI

member.name: P:Sustainsys.Saml2.Configuration.Compatibility.IgnoreMissingInResponseTo
member.summary: Ignore the check for the missing InResponseTo attribute in the Saml response. This is different to setting the allowUnsolicitedAuthnResponse as it will only ignore the InResponseTo attribute if there is no relayState. Setting IgnoreMissingInResponseTo to true will always skip the check.

member.name: T:Sustainsys.Saml2.Configuration.IdentityProviderDictionary
member.summary: A thread safe wrapper around a dictionary for the identity providers.
member.remarks: First I thought about using a ConcurrentDictionary, but that does not maintain any order of the added objects. Since the first idp added becomes the default idp, the order must be preserved. And there has to be queuing semantics if the first idp is dynamically loaded from a federation and later removed. Locks are simple and this part of the code shouldn't be that performance sensitive.

member.name: T:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2PSecurityTokenHandler
member.summary: Somewhat ugly subclassing to be able to access some methods that are protected on Saml2SecurityTokenHandler. The public interface of Saml2SecurityTokenHandler expects the actual assertion to be signed, which is not always the case when using Saml2-P. The assertion can be embedded in a signed response. Or the signing could be handled at transport level.

member.name: M:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2PSecurityTokenHandler.ProcessAuthenticationStatement(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml2.Saml2AuthenticationStatement,System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity,System.String)
member.summary: Process authentication statement from SAML assertion. WIF chokes if the authentication statement contains a DeclarationReference, so we clear this out before calling the base method http://referencesource.microsoft.com/#System.IdentityModel/System/IdentityModel/Tokens/Saml2SecurityTokenHandler.cs,1970

member.summary: Success.

member.summary: Error because of the requester.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.Responder
member.summary: Error because of the responder.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.VersionMismatch
member.summary: Versions doesn't match.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.AuthnFailed
member.summary: The responding provider was unable to successfully authenticate the principal

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.InvalidAttrNameOrValue
member.summary: Unexpected or invalid content was encountered within a saml:Attribute or saml:AttributeValue element.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.InvalidNameIdPolicy
member.summary: The responding provider cannot or will not support the requested name identifier policy.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.NoAuthnContext
member.summary: The specified authentication context requirements cannot be met by the responder.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.NoAvailableIdp
member.summary: Used by an intermediary to indicate that none of the supported identity provider Loc elements in an IDPList can be resolved or that none of the supported identity providers are available.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.NoPassive
member.summary: Indicates the responding provider cannot authenticate the principal passively, as has been requested.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.NoSupportedIdp
member.summary: Used by an intermediary to indicate that none of the identity providers in an IDPList are supported by the intermediary.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.PartialLogout
member.summary: Used by a session authority to indicate to a session participant that it was not able to propagate logout to all other session participants.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.ProxyCountExceeded
member.summary: Indicates that a responding provider cannot authenticate the principal directly and is not permitted to proxy the request further.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.RequestDenied
member.summary: The SAML responder or SAML authority is able to process the request but has chosen not to respond. This status code MAY be used when there is concern about the security context of the request message or the sequence of request messages received from a particular requester.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.RequestUnsupported
member.summary: The SAML responder or SAML authority does not support the request.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.RequestVersionDeprecated
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot process any requests with the protocol version specified in the request.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.RequestVersionTooHigh
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot process the request because the protocol version specified in the request message is a major upgrade from the highest protocol version supported by the responder.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.RequestVersionTooLow
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot process the request because the protocol version specified in the request message is too low.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.ResourceNotRecognized
member.summary: The resource value provided in the request message is invalid or unrecognized.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.TooManyResponses
member.summary: The response message would contain more elements than the SAML responder is able to return.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.UnknownAttrProfile
member.summary: An entity that has no knowledge of a particular attribute profile has been presented with an attribute drawn from that profile.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.UnknownPrincipal
member.summary: The responding provider does not recognize the principal specified or implied by the request.

member.name: F:Sustainsys.Saml2.Saml2P.Saml2StatusCode.UnsupportedBinding
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot properly fulfill the request using the protocol binding specified in the request.
